hPCMsao_S3NU_ss53PTkgQ.review_text: Wandered in here while looking for drinks with a friend in North Beach. It was less less loud/crowded/crazy than the place next door.   All most all of the patrons were old white dudes...but that might be explained by the bartender with her tits out for days.  They have a $15 card minimum, which on principal, is enough to never make me go back.   Their only redeeming factor is in-house infused vodkas. On the day I stopped in it was pineapple...freshly infused pineapple vodka. I had it with soda water, $7.  Overall, not a bar I would visit very often except to check out their newest vodka.

-Qf4ffBkhYailgZ57ZenOA.review_text: I am still fairly new to the city and was invited here by some friends. I hadn't made it out to this part of town yet, but now I would definitely come back. Amante was a fun little spot. It was pretty busy when I got there, but luckily my friends had snagged a table.   There are quite a few tables along the wall and then some seating at the bar. They play a good selection of music, but they play the music really loud. I had quite a few moments where I was trying to talk loud enough that my friends could hear me and the music would stop and I would still be yelling haha. This is not necessarily a place to go chat with friends, but definitely a relaxed place to go chill. I would think that with the music they were playing that people might be dancing, but no one was dancing either.   As for the drinks, I had beer, so I can't comment on the mixed drinks. The beer was reasonably priced and even at the busy moments in the night, the bartenders were fast! This place was good at keeping the drinks coming. Also, if you are sitting at a table they have wait staff that will take your drink orders. Although at the busy times in the night it was faster to go get a drink from the bar.

dUjWYjb8F-bWeKsS_lMfBg.review_text: I got to see some dude get heaved bodily from the front door for lighting up a joint inside the bar...which was pretty damned funny.  It was worth going just for that.  But...since the purpose of going to a bar is to drink and I had one crappy drink and one mediocre drink...I can't see giving it more than 3 stars.  It's a cute enough place and the people working there were nice...my drinks just didn't remotely approach stellar.  Though, I was informed by a reputable source that I just barely missed the good bartender.

qUg4PXAT42bxV48CqPaUwQ.review_text: Any respectable bar has to have character and that Amante does in spades. Like most places with unique character, a patron has to know the time they prefer to hit said bar and naturally that depends on what yer interest is. If you're looking for a mellow atmosphere to be able to have convo with your cocktail, then it's best to get in on the early eve' side of things. Otherwise be prepared to run into droves of those looking to "get their North Beach on." If you're not comfortable in a bar unless you're "pre-soaked," and requiring the requisite population of "man-tastic" and "shorty cakes" well then Amante may not be yer thing.  Went in before a dinner rezy for a quick cocktail. We were at first skeptical, thinking that we'd either stepped into a private Italian bar or J-Lo's boudoir. It's like a mini-Vegas, Ratpack-era bar, with mirrors, a stage and blue-walled interior setting the tone straight away. Huge "A" for -what else- Amante.  The place was seemingly dead. If you mistake Amante for Sleepy Hollow, you're making a big mistake; the place can get crowded in a flash when there's a band or with night owl revelers. Bartenders don't mess around when mixing drinks, preferring to offer a healthy dose rather than watering down like most places. Wiz is one of the best bartenders in the city and -to boot- has a great Ipod mix "soundtracking" the background for you. Clientle range from old school, eye-patch wearing fifty-somethings, to neighborhood fidi's looking for an option after Tosca or before they move on to do more serious damage. Don't be surprised if you see someone bringing their under-the-arm ankle biter in; most anything is tolerated as long as one behaves. Or, misbehave without getting up in anyones grill...especially Wiz's.

BOM_r6HaJnpMwXw82XbVAw.review_text: I am stingy with my 5 stars and since I didn't eat the food, I can't 5 star.... but... all 4 stars are for the bartender.  I am a new scotch drinker, which I communicated to the bartender and he suggested a new scotch I hadn't tried and loved it.  My friend wanted to try a new tequila and after just a couple questions, suggested a tequila that she really liked.    Long story short, bartender was certainly knowledgeable about multiple alcohols.

fM8egpsSDw4m13IAufkNcA.review_text: Great decor and good drinks...A definite place to stop in for a drink while in north beach.   Also an even better place to stop for a drink before the night ends...it has Golden Boy right up the street.

Mvsd7TvTeiCXnDOOHVHaEA.review_text: Fun place, very comfortable lots of seating (at least at 9pm) with a fun ambiance.  Major downside, only one bathroom and music was way to loud.  Drinks were good, but I had a hard time carrying a conversation with someone who was sitting right across the table from me, but that's to be expected.  Got pretty crowded around 11.45p, which was my queue to leave.  My recommendation:  make this the first stop of the night and move on when it starts to fill up.

99pcEZNPzjnrx4dnmT6WAA.review_text: Ruby Red Cosmos, best bartender in the city Eric... we will be back!

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: Excellent service, comfortable booths (some fit more than 4 people which is nice) and quick service at the tables and the bar.   Now thats the North Beach I know and love.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Stopped by here after the Union St. Festival to chill out. Everyone else came for the afterparty. Love the people that come here. All of them are super fun, outgoing, and definitely buzzing from the festivities.   There are tons of bars around that seem like they have been around for decades. This place has definitely been one of those staple spots for people to get wasted in the middle of the day with its cheap drinks and lively atmosphere.

P2fXcmsU_vrs4zB2IfsHnQ.review_text: Cool little place with nice decor.  Came here to celebrate my friend's bday and we ended up in a little corner next to the window. Pretty cool but beware the corner where we are with the window...it has pillows and is nice and cushion-y--makes you want to fall asleep.  Interesting music and people inhabit this place...so join the party! Score some free drinks from "interesting" people!

WI9UJah3bVB258wzEIh34A.review_text: A bad week can only be made worse by rampant alchohol consumption... Despite this truism, I have to say that I had quite the fine time (mostly) at Amante...  Really, the only reason I went to DYL was to see Christopher S. & to return Adrienne's green lighter - which had adopted me as it's surrogate smoker parent & had been living in my purse for some weeks.  After AG & GL (that's green lighter, people) were reunited you'd think I'd have had sense enough to return to the Mish from whence I came...  Oh, noes - I didn'...  Instead I stayed until at least 11:30pm at this fine establishment, imbibing alchohol, questioning people's identity & generally behaving like the drunk ass I am until such a time as my dear friend Chris S. poured me into a cab & said to the driver "Home, Jeeves."  Thank god someone has some sense around here!  Amante is a classy bar, perhaps too classy for someone who puts the "ass" in that word such as I do.

aJEZeCZEbT26XWjMWMJx1A.review_text: I never thought I'd like Amante.  It just looks like your usual stupid "upscale lounge" bar with ridiculous puffy throw pillows on the window ledges and silly sleek modern decore.  And yet, I have had a bunch of really enjoyable drunk nights there.  The bartender with the long, curly ponytail (is he still there?  I haven't seen him in a while) is so nice and pours strong drinks.

bF4BjnRuQdlL0MVYrSMLIw.review_text: good stiff drinks...from outside - looking in- looks like it could be a upti-tighty place but its not..u could be as comfortable in a suit or in flip flops in here and u would still get served the same 'ol stiff drink. plus they have some specials running wednesday thru friday on something....

PhAt76Bw5kVdEFfozawNtQ.review_text: i like the atmosphere in this place....it was perfect for a chill night and the bartender hooked us up with endless refills of blue dolphins (clutch!) the downside: some of the patrons don't know when to take their game elsewhere   line of the night: "i have a girlfriend anyway. and she's a nine. you guys are like, sixes"

mZ--Z5GELqrn9E6-KWLhTA.review_text: Finding the rest of your group when you're drunk is really hard. All stars go to the vaulted mirrors to help you locate them!

7qOYwZ_KrKdWcMAwD-hIdQ.review_text: i was visiting family and friends in SF and my nightlife choices were guided by friends of friends of friends. after a failed night of catching up with a college buddy due to the loud shitshow at circa, we decided to attempt normal conversation at amante. cute little bar with a friendly bartender. but um...what's with all the signs that say "please don't stand on the couches" ?? have so many people stood on the couches that they need to have signs?

_TBi1YmtfeLjJuG2EV26jA.review_text: Great bar in the heart of north beach. The crowd is a bit nicer than some of the surrounding bars (I'm looking at you Maggie's), but in a good way. A bit more relaxed, chatting, fewer fights, more room to move around.  Prices are on par for the area, bartenders are all friendly and quick. Nothing to not like about Amante.

8d6Mdzh_GWk9gZTqrsGJrw.review_text: Great decor! Our waitress was sweet and personable and kept the drinks coming! She even brought our hammered b-day friend water because he was done for the night. Booths are comfy and they play fun music!   I am totally going to come back here!

UsHxO3TTNJf8ijn9FvDRCw.review_text: Stopped in here to watch a Bowl game the other night and quickly realized this is not a great place to watch a game.  Only a handful of TV's and the layout is not conducive to groups trying to watch said games.  The wait staff was OK and the Asian influenced menu had a few good items but I was not impressed with the beer menu or the lack of non-spicy food items.

68IUpVhBJELMJIX8uMrw2w.review_text: I just have bad Karma in North Beach and every single time I have ever been to Amantes, I've ended the night by tossing my cookies.  They don't carry Hangar which is an issue for me because 1.) I'm not that big of drinker and don't substitute very happily, 2.) being as I don't drink very much, one drink is my limit (per 1.5 hours, oh this has been a difficult year of learning limits) or else I'm the embarassing drunk - so if I'm going to drink anything, it better be the stuff I like, damnit.

z3EvP4icWYeIR3xPXNkymQ.review_text: I stopped by for the first time last Wednesday night and saw Valeriana Quevedo and her group, sing up a storm. Nice room, good food, and the bar prices were not that bad. Val sings there every 1st Wednesday of the month (no cover) and is great, alot of musicians and singers came in to jam and the place was jumping. Definately will go back.

bq3Xewi5Uk9Md1KX83UQHA.review_text: Good small plates and pizzas.  The guy behind the bar with curly hair is named Wizz.  Ask him how he designed the copper bar, great story.

HvUXiTSN-Y8raG1pqQubtQ.review_text: Was here for a few minutes early in the Friday evening. A bar off Columbus. Nothing spectacular or inviting. The crowd consisted of young college boys, a bachelorette party, and a few groups of well-groomed girls.

lZ5PiW7FnK1IHC9_APvhYA.review_text: This was the spot I chose to have my post-job interview drink. The bar is awesome. I had this super cool older bartender who was absolutely great to talk to. You get quite a local vibe too, which is quite nice. Go for the Big Daddy IPA if you're looking for something new and a little hoppy.  The only reason this place didn't get 5 stars, is because the bar is separated from the dining room, despite the fact that both are in the same building. For example, if you're sitting at the bar, you cannot order food through the bartender. You have to pay at the food window. Making this worse, the food area is cash only. Strange.... But the food was BOMB DOT COM. I bought the chicken wings and the chicken, I'm pretty sure, had a party in my mouth. MMMM MM Good. It was real nice, real good, yummy in my tummy.

j4C14J6wq0lXSKYrBLrHFA.review_text: I'm glad my friends and I decided to come here this past Saturday.  The awful human being behind the bar was a good reminder that there are a lot of jerks out there, and one should be wary of pretentious grouchy bartenders. We got to the bar kind of late for a friends birthday.  My friend ordered our drinks- 2 cocktails and 2 beers and we all stood around chatting and waiting for them.  He gave my friend the total when the 2 beers were on the counter and ran the credit card, and when my friend asked about the two cocktails the bartender said he'd made them and put them on the bar, and we must have taken them.  Since we were all still standing right there waiting for our drinks we explained that this wasn't possible, and he then escalated the situation and accused us of stealing them to get free drinks. My friend calmly explained that no, he was standing right there, and we didn't grab the drinks, but the bartender continued getting more and more worked up and yelling at us.  He ended up pouring out the two beers we'd purchased in a dramatic fashion, and refunding my friends card, only after loudly making a scene and being rude to us.  If it were up to me we would have left, but since we were there for a birthday we had to stay.  So I, standing right next to my friend he was just rude to, proceeded to order the exact same drinks/ pay for them/ give them to my friends. Now I must add that this was a very crowded bar. We were not paying close attention after we ordered drinks.. just standing around and chatting as friends will do in bars.  So maybe someone grabbed them from the bar, or maybe he forgot to pour them, but the bottom line is that type of treatment was uncalled for and tacky.  I would have expected better from a cool bar like this. We could  have afforded many many drinks from that place, and are not in the habit of stealing drinks when going out with friends.  Chances are we would have gotten drunk and bought way too many drinks from here had the rude fellow behind the bar not killed everyone's buzz. Needless to say we will never be going back here.

sbVdImPlVRuf3-byN1F16A.review_text: After eating, my friend and I walked in here specifically for the house pineapple infused vodka. Absolutely fabulous! The vodka was so smooth, it had the texture of water and it tasted delicious. This vodka is dangerous as you could drink a whole pitcher of it on a hot day, only to realize 20 minutes later you are plastered. This did not happen to me, but it would have if I had kept drinking. Strangely, the alcohol didn't affect me that much.   The interior of the place is dark woods, dark lighting (so everyone looks better) and there's a huge jar behind the bar filled with vodka and a gigantic pineapple. I barely noticed anything else really. The atmosphere seems very chill for a bar. They also serve food from next door at the Chubby Noodle... the menu looked good but I wasn't there to eat. Next time!

b0p3fOxJcZjB3iTl7zoqTA.review_text: Don't be fooled by the big cheesy sign out front, it's actually a decent spot.  Plus, it wasn't too crowded on a Friday night.

vLfRgjVHw4zSiKOmM7XvqQ.review_text: I've been here when it was packed wall to wall with yuppies swarming the bar the guys with their shiny pitstained shirts and the girls in their halters tight jeans and stilettos.  I've also been here when it was so empty you could hear a pin drop. on a marshmallow.  and the pin was rubber.  The difference of a Thursday and a Friday, I guess.  Even when it was busy and I couldn't get a second round in until half an hour later, the bartender still had great memory retention.  And hey free matchboxes!

3fhIgNqd1jq_4sTWwA79Xg.review_text: Wizz is awesome.. The pineapple mango infused Vodka on the rox... Thanks for the tip Gary!

a8wKua129w25q4wtP26p2g.review_text: We first went for a friend's birthday in September. It was okay. The drinks weren't great, nor were they a decent price. It was pretty crowded. Minus for the single restrooms where the toilet is covered by a curtain. Anyway, our experience there wasn't so terrible that we'd never consider going back...  ... and we did go back, on Halloween...  The place was packed, which was expected. We ordered two drinks, but were given three (and yes were charged for three). But that's ok. Our night got better! Not only did it NOT rain on our halloween, but the couple sitting next to us was having sex... on the couch.  It was a truly hysterical moment when the two guys dressed as the ambiguously gay duo gyrated their crotches in the couple's faces... not realizing that they were having sex.  The waitress even came up and took their orders!  So yeah, it ended up being an awkward yet very entertaining time. But IF I go back, I will not be sitting on those couches.

OwACDpsXnfHRw7ce3xh2RQ.review_text: You know, I almost never like to post a bad review because I work on the restaurant industry and I know how much these things can hurt a business. But what happened the other night at Amante was so bad that I just had to say something. My friend and I like to have an occasional cigarette while we drink our wine. So we decided to go to Amante and sit outside. I specifically remember telling the bartender that we will be going outside so we can smoke. No sooner than we had lit our cigarettes, the same bartender came out and started pulling in all the chairs. When we asked why he said that it was because he wanted to go home early. He was rude and unapologetic, so we asked for the manager. Then he said that he was the manager and rushed us to chug our drinks. I later found out that that was a lie, because he is just a bartender. So caution people DO NOT, go to Amante when Fredo is working unless you want a lot attitude.  That being said, I'm a local North Beach resident and have had a lot of fun at Amante  because the other bartenders are really great

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: Amante's is always a solid spot for a night out in North Beach.  The crowd is usually ample and diverse, drinks are strong and reasonable and the space is open and comfortable. The most memorable part of my last visit:  homemade pineapple infused vodka...delicious but dangerous as all hell. I'm not sure if they infuse with other fruits through out the year but either way, it's worth trying for a special treat.

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: One of the better bars in the area. Owned by a bunch of bartenders, they know how to make a drink right. Any tough cocktails you've always liked but are often afraid to order for fear the bar will blow it? Get 'em here. Crazy crowded on weekends.

vLGnbOg0sHg4d6-JhorF2A.review_text: Me and my friends stopped by for a drink.. it is pretty small. they were having live band performance.. it is for older people.. the drinks were good, I ordered pineapple with voka.... it is a very chill atmosphere to hang out and get drunk with a few friends...

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: There are (surprisingly) lots of hot guys here. Since it's North Beach, they probably all turn into drunk, chauvinistic barfighting frat boys after 10 p.m. but I was fortunate to get here earlier than that. The bouncer was extremely friendly to me while maintaining a decent intimidation factor with other, less soft and cuddly individuals.   As for the cocktails, I drank a lot of somebody else's delicious mai tai (yum!) and I had a couple of decent, strong vodka sodas purchased for me while waiting for Boy to finish parking. Speaking of parking- you'd have to be stoned out of your mind to think you'll ever find parking in North Beach. Anytime. But especially on a Friday night. There is apparently a parking garage nearby, next to the police station. That would have been USEFUL and COOL to know beforehand.   Amante is extremely large and has plenty of comfy, cushy seating. It was the perfect place for our Friday night happy hour. The only complaint I heard (aside from the complaints about our noisy friends) was that drinks were hard to come by and not that great. I'd come back and I'll most definitely use Amante for large groups in the future.  One more USEFUL tip: when a striped shirt with highlights is walking down the street in North Beach with his equally striped shirted, highlighted mantourage, it's best not to yell, "pop your collar, Motherf*cker". Just take my word on that. (Hi, Amanda!).

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: I really can't find any faults in this bar at all. The interior is very cool and loungey. The lighting is perfect. The seating is varied, and well cushioned. The music seemed to be all of my favorites from the 90s. The infused vodka was tasty, although I did wonder if there was any alcohol present, as it tasted like juice. The last piece to the puzzle is the food, which I have yet to try...

8pjrrLQwGw0wlp_k9E0vwA.review_text: First of all I love this place. I feel like family when I come here. The owners Wiz and Mike are fucking fabulous. Eric and Alfredo are amazing to chat with and make great drinks.   Lastly a personal shout out to my favorite Sarah. Great personality, drinks and looks. She has the complete hospitality package.   Been a regular here for about 6yrs. Always consistent.

ybzQMBPwxVNGmTQO_5fHNg.review_text: Bartender was a dickhead!! I was sick and brought in water from a nearby place. He gave me an attitude and said they don't allow other drinks from other places  I didn't know it would be an issue and so I asked him if he could spill the water out so I could return the glass to them. He did and the handed the glass back with an attitude he asked for IDs from me and my boyfriend even though I asked for water. He then gave an attitude again so I asked him "why the attitude?" He apparently misheard me and said he was a Mexican. He thought I said "why the accent? " after the clarification he said that he's not the one with an attitude. I did not gve him an attitude- not even when asking about his own attitude. I asked for the manager in which he magically became the manager. He then refused to serve us and kicked us out. I would never recommend anyone going here for the horrid service.

RBZ_kMjowV0t6_nv2UKaDQ.review_text: This is a perfect divey bar to visit, especially on a rainy day! The bar is cozy and casual which is the perfect combination. The drinks are stiff but reasonably priced, the staff is friendly and the patrons are anything but stuffy. I especially enjoyed their very random menu of food options. They serve items like fried chicken and then Asian noodles. Like I said, it's random but it seems to work! Amante is spacious for San Francisco standards so it's a good place to visit with friends. That's about all I can say about Amante, except that it's worth a visit right meow!

kXSEepDXV-DwiA_6BFzE9g.review_text: Bartender was unfriendly after we went inside to see whether or not the 5 of us sitting outside would ever be served (after sitting here for 10+ minutes and watching the tables around us get served).   And I know what you're thinking, but I was with my girlfriend and 70+ year-old parents, so we were not obnoxious/aggro/etc.   They just don't care about your business so take it somewhere else.

qQa9J0fXA6E-3JSFNsF7TA.review_text: This is why I don't do North Beach. It's not like I didn't know what to expect but I came because a couple of my friends were DJ'ing. There is no dedicated DJ area/booth so my buddies had to nestle in a little corner with their turntables sitting at one end of the bar. Adding insult to injury, their sound system was horrible with nasty distortion on the high end like the tweeter was blown or something. To compensate, they had to turn down the overall volume way low.   The crowd is typical North Beach. There was no reaction when the classic club banger "Can't Stop, Won't Stop" by the Young Gunz was played, yet they went stone crazy like it was 1987 when Van Halen's "Jump" came on. Wow, just wow.  In their defense, the female portion of the crowd was quite attractive. There was an exotic looking dime in a white dress who kept making eye contact but left before I could make my move. If you are reading this, I'm the dude who was w/ the DJs. Holla.

Xei4NJ0N_SkdQ42xxrk67Q.review_text: Came here on a Saturday night with a couple friends and it was pretty empty. However, the pineapple martini is pretty darn amazing. Foamy, refreshing and very pineapple-y. Get it.

Uw2JnDNO7iti_qvTm4MlRw.review_text: I've always associated the neon streets of North Beach with tourists, because that's how I feel when I'm walking down the street there, as they bump into me in the cold night wearing shorts with sandals, and the various door-people at the strip clubs attempt to tenderly coax me inside their doors. I hurry past the nonsense to meet my friends at Amante.  It's so damn close to all the lights that Amante isn't really a true escape. The huge televisions dominate most surfaces and I doubt there is a truly regular crowd. Is it a sports bar, or is it supposed to be cool? The staff was beyond nice for a busy bar, the drinks stiff and the atmosphere generic. A big little bar with almost no personality except for being in North Beach.  Met some questionable folks and had some great conversations, and as those closest to me began to call it a night, I was faced with the choice of continuing my adventure with new people or heading home. Before you know it I'm in a cab with a new friend heading towards Polk Street.

0ewvp9BUbNq1lqdWeTnLHw.review_text: Brought my three girlfriends from LA. They gave Amante a thumbs up. We came there on a Saturday night during fleet week. It was very crowded but we were able to squeeze ourselves to get to the bar. Got served right away and the drinks were strong and delicious, just how we like our men.   Even though there were many girls giving us the mad dog looks, we didn't care because we were having fun and enjoying ourselves.  Ladies, who were giving us the mad dog looks, don't hate us because we're nicer, if you would only take those sour looks off your faces you too could have men coming up to you!   Amante's receives 4 stars. Thanks for the great time!

Q2RsDOhzsCBI-F1oOPe6Lg.review_text: So chic and upscale. Loving this bar! It seems more of a lounge than a bar which is why it's 5 stars. I haven't tried the food so 5 stars only for the bar.  Been here once and sat at the bar. The bar tenders were fantastic!! We chitchatted about various alcohols and the infused pineapple vodka. I was convinced to try it. Wow, it was marvelous!!!   Many of the patrons were coming in and out for a quick drink and they were out. They all seemed to know the bartenders too. I figured they must be regulars. I mean why wouldn't you be a regular if you lived close by. It's off the hook here!!

ZHKTYA-ZNVLwH5wTFBCiYQ.review_text: This place is great. We reached out to them ahead of time because we were having a bar crawl and let them know we were coming, They gave us special deals and made sure they had the staff on hand to work with us. I am sure glad they did because it turned out to be the best experience we had on the entire bar gold pub crawl. I will be back! Make sure this is number 1 on your list!

v3ial-ln4kh1RgM7BQxXoA.review_text: b e s t    f i s h    t a c o s!!

_don8EWxNsvRdjDJqWbw0w.review_text: This place was nice! Sandwiched inbetween Italian restaurants, its hard to know what to expect.  The bartender served up some really nice drinks which were pretty cheap for the city, nice ambiance, good crowd and my friends really enjoyed the food from chubby noodle.

ODSH1it5oAUPu2clIgOvyg.review_text: Such an awesome bar. The bartender and I had the worst case of hiccups and she had some weird remedy. Unfortunately and fortunately, the cure worked 50% of the time, everytime. Thank goodness! The place is a pretty cool hangout spot to watch your favorite sports game. The service is great and the drinks pretty good. If you use a card, there's a $15 minimun, so be prepared for that. There's also a kitchen AKA Chubby Noodle that has great service, make sure you try the korean tacos (amazing!). Takes cash only. It was a wednesday afternoon so it wasnt busy at all. I can see myself here on a Friday/Saturday night

JNyLyXn-unUhJmiGJnI6tQ.review_text: Amante is a little too multiple personality for my taste.  Is it a bar?  A club (that it Biggie I hear, no?)?  A restaurant?    Confused, I order yet another vodka soda (it's strong, so that's good), down it, and then head back to the bathroom.  The bathroom with a curtain instead of a stall door.  I know it has been said before, by others, and now by me, but the bathroom has a curtain instead of a stall door.  Did they invest too much in their 100" TV to be able to afford a real door?  And get this: According to Amante's Web site, they've got a consulting service.  I quote, "Are you interested in opening up your own bar or restaurant? Let us help you reach that goal with our combined knowledge of 55 years in the restaurant industry."  So with the help of Amante's owners, you too can open a bar-club-restaurant that doesn't waste resources on such frivolities as bathroom doors!

ghRwENzjazf5b94m5ga5NQ.review_text: Super chill atmosphere during the week.  Friendly bartender that explained the process used when making the unique bar.  I recall saying shortly after arriving that "This is my new favorite place."  I was in a really good mood so that may be stretching it...but Amante's helped that good feeling right along.  I look forward to visiting again on a night when they have live music.  It may even get a fifth star from me when I have spent more than two-pints-worth of time here. Cheers!

91YfQoC9Np0Dj6UaSpX2Rw.review_text: Great ambience in a centrally located spot in North Beach. Tap beers are $5, which is almost the same as some other divey places I have been to. And this place is in no way a dive bar. The bartending was great as well.  Didn't try the food, but the connected Chubby Noodle does give some options if hunger strikes. The menu looked fairly limited, but interesting, though.

-hNWeSQlZlEQe1MdCQdspA.review_text: Real, genuine, fun. If tired with the superficial-trendy-hype atmosphere of these insipidious-beautiful-people places, where people "pretend" to have fun, rush to Amante. Experience may vary (avoid rush hours, the later the better).  By the way, could the hype-mayor of this city do a little lobbying to make party hours acceptable in SF? Closing at 2 AM when people *start* to have fun is a real crime. San Francisco deserves a special status to save its nightlife (fed up of ending at the End Up)

5YpLep4KSQL65Vq1uljzyw.review_text: Great Bar!!!  These are real bartenders.  They pour a real drink, you don't have to sell some blood to pay for it, and their are always some pretty ladies there.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: 4 words Pineapple infused vodka martinis. Large open space. Crowd can be hit or miss. A lot of randoms and stumblers. Music is random and off the wall which was awesome. From rap to 80's. A great place to meet friends and just relax with a cocktail in hand.

XiVlH054UZ3A964ZIrBkPg.review_text: Less than awesome is being approached in a bar by a dude, having him quote lines from your yelp reviews, and then him telling you you're an arrogant and conceited bitch. It's called being facetious, asshole.   More than awesome is heading out to a rad birthday party (woo Anna!) and having a great time. I had some too-drunk issues earlier in the evening, and I appreciate the speed with which I was delivered my water and how nice and accommodating the bouncer was. Instead of telling me to stay outside, he cracked jokes about how I was looking less green with each lap around the block and that it was perfectly fine for me to keep coming in and out for fresh air.   I've been to Amante a ton of times, and it's the kind of high-ceiling, couch-filled bar that is perfect for both big groups and cozy dates. There's enough room to roam the floor, and while I would have liked the bathroom stall to have a door rather than a curtain, it was nice never having to wait in line.   I do regret leaving the fun and very chill Amante for the other bar where said jerk decided to be Captain Bringdown, but you know what? It's not arrogance if it's true, and I'm awesome, if only because I associate with people that are both sweethearts and fun as all get out.

F7SgSRGCnNDiPz9EBaicgw.review_text: Came in on a Saturday night with 19 of my closest friends (Drunken trolley ride stop). Definitely a chill vibe, not quite a party destination. Nice decor & lighting situation. It felt very mature & grown up.. def not a dirty dive. My bartender lady was very nice & didn't take 100 yrs to get me drinks & door guy outside seemed like he'd be angry but was actually super cool to socialize with on our smoke breaks.. Plus he told me he liked my cowboy boots.. that's 5 stars in my book!

CMNeas2Y8ai4ImpPwgwAew.review_text: Fun bar! I hadn't been in years, since I now live in NYC, but I dropped in with a rather large group of people for some cocktails and it was a good time. They have infused vodkas and lots of seating, so it was a good place for us to hang out and catch up with old friends or chat up new ones. Made me miss my days of old in North Beach...

Xorep_PXj9XQH3UVquaZAA.review_text: I have been coming here since it opened a few years back and it's still a great place to go for drinks. The bartenders are wonderful, especially Eric and Alfredo. Very sweet guys. They are the type to cut you off when you have been drinking way too much but in the nicest way. LOL. No, Corey it wasn't me they cut off. Spacious place but can get really packed. If you want a seat definitely arrive early. They can make accomodations for large and private parties. The drinks are delish!

ZBLZIOrO3DZJzDFlFO-bJw.review_text: I'm not a huge fan of north beach. It reminds me too much of a frat party or it is where the east bay and packs of aggro guys come to party on the weekend. Amante is different though. It has dancing and unlike a lot of places in north beach is pretty big. I was impressed that they played a little salsa music the other night. I'd definitely go back. I do wish it had a larger spot to dance but I appreciate music + drinks.

suuIf6JWTZFjSu55k7zTBA.review_text: Amante is one of those hybrid establishments that attempts to please a wide range of clientele.    There are big screens for sports enthusiasts, a long curvy booth for recliners, a long hammered copper bar for pizazz seekers...they also have high ceilings and a comfy-cozy middle area for some breathing space.  The staff are attentive and friendly.  They even have Blue Moon brew on tap - a bonus for White Belgium ale lovers.  On the back bar, there's a tempting looking concoction of mango & pineapple infused alcohol.  I hear it's a delicious but 'dangerous' drink since it's sooo easy to drink.  A must try for next time.

vWpe19iYR30nE8JvBtjwKg.review_text:
I think the first night I went to this place they played the drum roll and this beautiful lady stood at the end of the bar and flashed the whole crowd....I think the bartender's egged her on though...they are THAT kind!
  So of course, for the next 6 weeks I was on a North Beach kick because I thought every bar in North Beach was just that much fun.  Not true of course, but man!  That was a great 6 weeks!

RwTGtXFLaInMygIbtViSyA.review_text: This place is awesome! Clean, nice, great music on, great food, unbelievable staff. Every time I go into this place, they always have done something a little extra. And on the big nights...wow! I've had a couple of New Years Eve parties there I won't ever forget. They just go the extra mile to make sure you have a fantastic time.

06xIElWq6CAvmtk1xHJWNA.review_text: Free olives, good drinks, and great pomme frites. I love nice pomme frites in butcher paper, I'm such a sucker for that... Minus a star for smelling like puke on this particular day... yeah, I know its a bar, I figure it doesn't ALWAYS smell like this... but normally I wouldn't even give a rating higher than 2 stars for just that... BUT *Free olives... o, and maraschino cherries, too!*

cgDZVtYICeiK5t1rkesamg.review_text: Fun place to have a drink with a big group of friends!  After dinner at Don Pisto's, our group moseyed on to Amante for some more drinks and continue our chatfest.  When we walked in there, all the tables were pretty much taken.  As we were deciding what to do, the manager came up to us and asked how many was in our party. We told him and he told us that they can set up a table for us outside under the heatlamps. Great! That solved our problem!   We were seated a few minutes later outside which tuned out to be perfect. It was a little noisy inside with the music blaring.  Outside, we were able to talk without yelling and losing our voice.    My first drink was a Kentucky Mule which was nice, not too stiff, but not watered down either.  I ordered a Cosmo later on and that was good too. Beer, Campari and soda, and Moscow Mules were the other drinks people ordered. One friend ordered food from Chubby Noodle and he said it was good.   We were there for about three hours.  We were a big group, so I made it easier for our group of 10 and the server by giving her my credit card for our tab. I just had everyone one pay me back at the end of the night.  At around 11:30 pm, after paying our bill, we walked a few feet and stood in line at Golden Boy Pizza for a snack. I like that you can buy food from Chubby Noodle (cash only) while having a drink here or get pizza later a few doors down. And when we needed a taxi fast, we were able to get one right away! Will definitely be back here!

MJ6I2dX9-QZMw5bL-9inTA.review_text: A group of us went to Amante to celebrate a birthday and we had a blast. It was the first time for all of us, but we were totally welcomed by the bartenders and waitress. The ambiance is really great and the place had a really nice crowd going. Not overly packed where sweaty drunk boys are rubbing elbows with you, but a good size.  We'll definitely be back for more!

5keAoLzGQ2D06Zm_VbOwSA.review_text: Bouncer is a jerk and unprofessional. Go here all the time, typically the workers are nice. Get there prior to a Giants game and there are a few tables open outside. We take the only table left that you can watch the game from, it seats 4 people. Bouncer asks us to move unless we have more people coming. I ask if it is first come first serve, he states that it is but he would like us to move. I again say we do not want to because you cannot see the game from the other open tables. When we refuse his request for the third time he tells us to leave... Loved this place I have been going here for two years almost every week. I will never go again! We were polite the entire time, I was completely shocked by his treatment.

yVXR8ghRqFppf7UAQPegRA.review_text: Tell Wizz and Mike that they are GENIUSES!!!  This bar is a bright, shiny, sparkly treasure done up in copper and jewel-tones nestled in the historic and eccentric neighborhood of North Beach.  I lived in North Beach for over 7 years, and no place made me feel more like a princess than the entire cast of characters at Amante.  Thank you all, and I'll be seeing you!

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Oohhh!  I like this place!  It's very cozy and dark inside.  They  make a really good martini and bloody mary.  The bartenders are really efficient and nice.  I've been here on a weekday night, and it was super mellow.  Fun to just chat with a friend at the bar.  I've also been here on a Saturday night, and had so much fun people-watching.  Let's just say that there was a dance contest going on (informal of course), and one of the contestants de-pantsed himself.  It was hilarious.  One of those, "Is this for real, or did I drink too much vodka?" moments.  This bar is a no-attitude place, and very fun.

l7V5w_vf9xv74As3abZukA.review_text: Great wide selection of draft beers combined with nice classy decor.  You would not expect it if you were just walking down the street comparing it to the other bars up & down Green & Grant.   I like that the clientele is usually a little older & more mature. But it's been a long time since I've been & it was on a non-weekend night.

8DqQqPnWLMllH2Dd0bETtQ.review_text: Hole #1 For my friends birthday night. yelp.com/list/lillians-b… Had a beer and some cocktail that featured their pineapple infused vodka, the birthday girl ordered it, gotta make the b-day girl happy... Pretty chill crowd when we got here, (it was relatively early) the staff here was pretty nice, drinks came quickly and pretty reasonably priced.  Definitely be worth a stop next time im in the area.

2cQjPQaeYym48WhqUgoy7Q.review_text: Went here after my dinner at Masa's for a few cocktails.  The group of people were a bit younger than me but they were nice and polite.  Not the normal loud and drunk little Italy group that hang out here in htis part of town.  We sat outside and watched the people going by what fun.  I hope we were not as drunk as some.  The service was good and Mike the owner was very fast, made a great drink and was not too bad on the eyes either.  Will make this one of my new stops in the Broadway loop. Check them out .

JADdo9NEeO5Az9aOYbyvZA.review_text: Gotta luv this bar, fun crowd, different theme each week, but 1 freaking toilet? What's up with that?  It's definitely a good place to kick it!

kNOa1uYcba620JzlAELPig.review_text: Well, it's walking distance from a bunch of different bars. Drinks are alright. The place does have a very cute bathroom. That's all I got.

UgOhVGUOMfCPFt7AF5MWog.review_text: Golden oldies playing overhead, pineapple infused vodka, sake flights (score!), chubby noodle in the kitchen with the most amazing chicken tenders on the planet - what's not to love!?  Amante is perfection.  No frills, ample drink choices, and some of the best food in North Beach if you're not feeling Italian. Pretty sure they have Wifi too since I saw some fantasy drafts take place there last night.  Really diverse crowd if you're into people watching (it's SF so you better be), and the staff is super friendly.  If I lived in NB this would definitely be my go-to spot, but I'll settle for whenever I'm in the hood.

W6fuQ6QitzS9AIKBqLHkEQ.review_text: Had a great time with a group of friends at Amante! The door man was wonderful, accommodating our luggage until we were ready to leave. He also dealt with some unruly drama fiends in a professional way. All I know is someone threw a plastic cup in my direction during an argument and the argument didn't last long with the doorman intervening. My friends and I ordered a couple bottles of Chardonnay and tapas. The food was delicious- we had the pepper prawns and the pork shoyu ramen bowl; I especially thought the roasted corn in the soup was a nice touch. Our bar tender was very attentive and our food came out quickly after we ordered. He also kept the water coming which was extremely appreciated.  The place was pretty packed, so we started out at the bar but we were able to move to a table once our other companions arrived. Very fun place. I should add that the women's restroom only has a curtain around the stall, but you can easily lock the main door if this is an issue.

r-8eQ28RhnQPJdZXHcTXrw.review_text: Chill bar.  Looks very old school outside but it has casual contemporary booth seats on the inside.  They blast radio hits from the last five years or so and have the TVs tuned to baseball or basketball games.  They also house Chubby Noodle.

y2XPvYkAIZWxyknRQYM_EA.review_text: This place reminds me exactly why I have avoided North Beach nightlife since I've been living in SF- it has perhaps some of the highest douche proportions I failed to remember. Why oh why was I convinced to come out here?? The bartenders were nice, and the drinks were decent, but the crowd was a big deterrent. I think there was some "cowboy" party that infiltrated and one of them proceeded to shove his ass in my face. When my friend asked him nicely to scoot over, he literally got in her face and told her to "chill out"...really? Next we were almost molested by a miserably drunk guy who was practically spitting all over us.  I remember this place as being a lot nicer...it just seems grittier. I also recall that there was a cocktail server who used to take orders, and somehow this was distinctly missing. The whole experience just reminds me why I need to NOT come to North Beach for the nightlife any time soon again....strip clubs, drunken fights- ahhh the nostalgia

LpVJ7DQ0K7qqIqDw_jMdTg.review_text: I like this place.  The fact that I saw my favorite band play an acoustic set here makes me like it even more.  Located in the middle of North Beach, this cozy lounge/bar has a right amount of class and dive all at the same time.  My only complaint is that their beer tap selection could be a little bit expansive.  I'll definitely be heading out again to Amante (given I'm in the North Beach area)  Recommended

wJwLP9O7go2dxVhUpQ0jCA.review_text: went here a few times, and every time it was a good experience.  I remember first encountering this place in the afternoon on a weekday.  Of course it was quiet and slow, but the bartender was nice.  He even introduced us to a good wheat beer.  So my friends and I celebrated in finding a cool new bar with some shots!  (FYI stick to one drink....Patron and Jameson do not mix.)    Another weekday, quite a few of us went and we were basically the whole crowd.  But we still managed to be lively.  Double Shots chased down with beer will definitely do the trick.  The bartender that day was real cool too and very sociable.  Last time i went there, it was with the usual gang but the first time being there on a weekend.  Totally different atmosphere.  I wasn't used to seeing a lot of people there.  The crowd was cool, the bartenders were friendly as usual, and the drinks were great!!!

puS8HuNdeXhhl5F4bb0EEg.review_text: This is a winner!  I like the decor, very classy.  The music's not loud,  you can actually have a conversation.  And the margarita was awesome.  They played my song "Happy Together" by the Beatles...so this is definitely a keeper :)

Uqg8zgMw-JYJNpjVtFXqng.review_text: Amante's is very nice inside, I will give it that.   But other than the cool decor and prime location (I live very close) I don't think this place is worth going to. North Beach has some great bars for after-work relaxing, to meet and mingle or to get trashed with your friends. Amante isn't one of them.  I don't know, this place is just boring. I'm all for a chill bar, but this one may be too chill in comparison to other choices.

ThpoaPHDW5fNj_fYvNsiaQ.review_text: First off, I would like to say that this is the FIRST review I have ever written. I signed up for Yelp just to write this.   This was by far the worst customer service experience I have ever had. When paying for the tab we asked our server if he would split the tab up 8 ways on different cards. He agreed that that was fine. He came back a few minutes later to retrieve our money and my friend that hands him the cards says we have $40 cash and 7 cards and he was like no, no I just want to run the cards and not take the cash. So then my friend was like ok well there are only 7 cards instead of the 8. Well, our server still divided our bill up 8 ways on the 7 cards. So when he came back to retrieve our signed receipts, kept asking where the last receipt was. He started getting all perplexed and was like no there were 8 slips. My friend, re-explained what she had already told him about there only being 7. He then proceeds to tell us that we were a bunch of drunk girls and didnt know what he was talking about (it was 830pm on a saturday and we had each only had 1-2 drinks as well as dinner the 2 hours we were there) and that it wasn't his fault. He started getting a horrible attitude with us and yelling at us. We were NOT trying to screw him by any means and wanted to make it right but he would not listen to what we were saying. THEN, to make matters WORSE, the OWNER, yes OWNER comes over and yells at us saying that this issue was taking away from the other customers and that we needed to get this issue resolved. Ok, I am sorry but please do NOT yell at US for your server making a math error!! So, instead of leaving we were STILL trying to make things right, so we head over (just my friend and I who have BOTH been in the service industry) to where the owner and our server were to try to resolve it. We asked him what was the difference owed. Our server then tells us that he would like us to "get the hell out of there and out of his face." Seriously?!?! 8 girls that ALL live in North Beach, that come in there quite often are now NEVER going back there. That was the rudest I have EVER been treated at a restaurant in my life. We will never be going back there and I am definitely going to make it a point to tell everyone else I know not to ever go back there as well.

FasNCo26SxBqncV3nX2-mQ.review_text: Anna K. had her birthday party here last night.  Luckily, this bar is pretty big because she's pretty popular.  hehe  They have big tables that would be perfect for playing cards if you had some.  We didn't.  But it was a good (albeit brief) thought.  I was so impressed by the bartenders.  I never had to wait long for my irish car bombs ...and it was packed!  Happy Birthday, Anna!

o-t-i7nbT5N_cmkCXs5oDQ.review_text: I was on the verge of wastedness when I ended up at Amante after watching the 4th of July fireworks. Not my kind of place... but I did end up having a pretty good time nonetheless. My friends and I had a few booths reserved, and I most definitely would have passed out on one of the couches if it hadn't been for the endless reruns of the day's hotdog eating contest on the giant TV screens, and more specifically of Kobayashi barfing in his hands... delightful!   Then, as can be expected at this kind of place, I got hit on by a girl. Big time.   Straight Girl: Heeheehee, can I sit next to you? Heeheehee.... David: Huh... yeah... (I tend to freeze when straight girls hit on me) SG: Are you having fun? Heeheehee.... David: Hmmm yeah, I'm here with my friends for a wedding celebration... SG: Oh that's nice, but I hope you're not the one getting married... heeheehee... David: No, not me, my friend Jeremy over there.... SG: To the girl with the blonde hair? David: Well, not that one, another girl with blonde hair. SG: Oh heeheehee... oh my.... You're wearing a ring, are you married? David: No, I'm not married...  (to myself: hellooooo... look at me... do I look straight?... and I'm sitting next to my bf with my hand on his leg... which planet do you come from?...) SG: Oh good... I wouldn't want to be hitting on you with your wife here... heeheehee... David (vomits in his mouth): Heeheehee... SG's brother (to SG, in her ear, but loud enough for me to hear): Sis, that dude is GAY! SG (to me): Heeheehee... my brother says you look really nice... Heeheehee...  God, I almost felt straight when I walked out of there.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: I'm slightly ashamed to admit that I went to Amante for the first time last night even though I've lived nearby for two years... for whatever reason though, Columbus Cafe would always seem to lure us in...  We were at Amante briefly last night to meet up with friends. The ambiance was really pleasant and my Captain Morgan's with pineapple juice was the best I have ever had!  Do they have a happy hour to compete with Columbus Cafe's awesome token-y happy hour?!

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: i'm never in this part of NB, was was here for the NB faire.  kool litte place for NB with friendly staff, but if you want a stronger drink or heavy handed shot...order from the owner.

R4DVayqiW63jHle7AG_NXQ.review_text: This place is super nice. Love their live music on wednesdays, the crowd, and the vibe. Drinks are served with a smile, and it's quite a spacious, nice establishhment. Will go back on a weekend with some friends and update the review accordingly.

NO6YrLQ4xUJ4_dJRD2f4ww.review_text: I like the bar well enough. Chubby Noodle is an excellent addition, though the two ticket system can be a pain at times. What I don't like is coming to watch the Giants and being asked to leave. Two of us got there in time to get one of the 4 tops outside to watch the game, we were asked to move to the seat directly below the TV. You can't watch the game from there, so we said no. The bouncer stood over us for a little bit and then asked us to leave. Amante is a decent bar as long as you aren't going during any games. Either way, I won't be back.

ySnJRrXNpbHuGYsm5mEAVA.review_text: Great setting and in the heart of north beach without the pretentiousness that other places provide.  If you just want a drink and enjoy friend's company...this is the place for you.  Also fun for dancing later in the evening and who can beat the fact that they are on the same block as a lobster shack and a pizza place?  Too good to be true at closing time!

Pp72B99pJ5a1WlvbAoat-g.review_text: I went here with my girlfriend after dinner last weekend after reading some reviews.  Amante is located on a good strip of bars and restaurants in North Beach away from the hustle and bustle (putting it nicely) of Broadway.  For midnight on a Saturday, it had the perfect-sized crowd (enough people that you don't feel like you're missing out on something somewhere else, not so busy that you cannot get to the bar).  The decor and lighting were nice, I dig the mirrors behind the bar.  The music was standard fare hip hop and the like.  It was loud enough to notice but not so loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation.  The drinks were a little weak, but they were fairly inexpensive so I didn't feel cheated.  In all it's a good place to wander into or to start a night but I wouldn't call it a destination spot.

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: Get here a little bit earlier than the typical bar scene and this place is really mellow. Get here a little late and you might meet a girl who says "hello" by throwing up on your shoes (true story). Anyway, during the week, the comfy couches, Amante allows you to unwind for a really happy hour. And surprisingly, they have the best fried calamari we've tried in the city so far - really light, crispy batter without the grease.

hkOiI-ctPYFuurzJZF6H9Q.review_text: I left the city to go live in the jungle for 6 months and Amante was the last bar I went to.  Amante to me is what's great about bars in San Francisco - the girls in big shoes and black pants feel just as comfortable as the boys in flip flops, shorts and sleeveless parkas with long-sleeved rugby shirts... The drinks are super strong so everyone is rather friendly... The music can bump everything from Madonna to Groove Armada to some crazy under ground stuff I didn't even know... The bartenders are friendly... and it's dangerously close to Golden Boy... that spell fun!

WDleS2FNQZnbQ7koiO-xuw.review_text: Whatever. Friday and the place was empty compared to all those around. Vague explanation as to what food they had. No happy hour things advertised. Don't make me ask what you have and how much it is. Went elsewhere down the street.

zpWizDgUk4-rQJXdjiBY1w.review_text: This place was cute, but a little empty.  I went with a group of 10 people. This was our first stop, we sat around the table and each ordered drinks. Their drink menu is pretty decent, $7 drinks, not too shabby!! I forgot what I got that night, but it did have malibu rum in it, which makes it a delicious drink. I think it was a tropical storm, who knows.   This is where the bar hopping started and kind of ended... maybe it was the mood or the sitting down part. Who knows. I would come back for the drinks, but would want to make sure that we don't sit down at one of their tables. I think this would have been a good place to end the night, but not start it.

98Ivr1U5d-Ohyq9DrT4ncg.review_text: This place is fantastic. 4 stars only because the bartender was a douchebag once but apart from that I have had a wonderful experience everytime I have been here. The good thing is that you can get food from here since it also has chubby noodles restaurant. You may come here from Don Pistos, another very good establishment in north beach since the restaurant and the kitchen in Amante is owned by the same individual.  Enjoy the atmosphere here, people are nice and trying to have a good time. Most of it is a younger crowd but you'll always run into a few oldies.

YFNAYiWUDuNqv57VS5tXPg.review_text: Chubby Noodles was delicious. The drink were well made but nothing to write home about. I ate the Pork Braised Ramen (enough to share) and Kung Fu Chicken.

QDuONv3yYUSF-2oyTgR67A.review_text: Chicken strips. They are out of this world!! for about $10, you get a small bucket that has 5 strips.  It is more than enough food for one meal.  the special sauce is also amazing!  Give it a shot, it wont disappoint.

tpSWa88HEv2OgD3RZuGNqg.review_text: Great bunch of people running this place. If you're in the NB and looking for a place to get lit, you cannot do wrong at the big A.  And get some food while you're at it.  Try the chicken skewers with a double bourbon chaser--my favorite.

220NBEU9WyTrI077MPPlJg.review_text: No cover! Horray!  On a drunken Saturday night, the weekend before St. Patrick's Day, we skipped out of King of Thai Noodle bar through the crowded sidewalks of North Beach and found ourselves inside Amante.  Large place, with a large bar (makes getting a drink much more pleasant), and seating! Classier than I was expecting (from North Beach, and in general), with ambient lighting and boppin' music. Seating definitely upped the place a couple stars for me. After a 2-hour trek through Lands End and Golden Gate Park earlier that day, the last thing I wanted to do was stay on my feet the whole night.   Went up to the bar and asked for "vodka with pieces of fruit in it" because that's what was recommended on Foursquare. The bartender probably thought I was a little mentally challenged, but if he was, totally hid it well and said, "Well, we have pineapple infused vodka, you want to try that?" It turns out that that was exactly what I wanted to try!   Ordered it on the rocks (will try martini next time) and took some sips. It went down really smoothly and was definitely pineapple-ly. I decided to make it even more delicious by asking for a glass of Sprite (for free, yay!) and mixing it in. It was very yummy.   Drinks not too expensive (beer was only $5!) and we chatted over the loud music. Really awesome place to chill with a big group if you're in North Beach for non-strip club reasons.   Only gripe: the bathroom only had 1 stall. I don't think it really bothered my friend, though. She took a look at the line and decided the men's bathroom would be just fine for her. The guy who arrived shortly after she went in was pretty surprised/confused when she came out!

_7fk4-KdfN2CwsqDushe7g.review_text: Let's face it...a step up from other local North-beach eats & drinks. Nice place to stop in and meet with friends. Great to see Bobby Mccambridge during the day and the Owners giving it a club feel when the sun goes down. In my opinion they have hit the mark when it comes to a nice place where everybody knows your name....neighborhood bar. GOOD JOB! Definitely gonna go again!

Q-kBgH-JZSLKqkdzUG9YQA.review_text: This is a great place for FISH TACOS! We've eaten here several times and always order fish tacos; they are great. Not what you would expect to find at a bar. To clarify, these tacos are delicious even prior to several Captain & Cokes or Ketel Sodas with a squeeze of lime. I typically order the fries which come with a side of ranch dressing and ketchup. Some of the best fries I've ever eaten. I think they drizzle crack on them to make so addicting. The come in a cone shaped holder-thingy and I usually try to squeeze my hand into the skinniest part on the bottom to get the last of the fries at the bottom. Recently tried a pizza and was not disappointed. The ribs were edible but I would not order them again.

OZmtokMDUkol8x19D0sxwA.review_text: Great upscale bar without the upscale attitude. The staff dominates  the beautiful copper bar and the fish tacos are out of this world.

jkr3YVCEoRNKkxinUZpW6A.review_text: Yes to Chubby Noodle, but no to the cheesy music and bad drinks at Amante.  They served up possibly the worst whiskey sour I've had-- something was completely off with their lemon juice.    But for Chubby Noodle and their peppered duck noodles?  Totally worth a visit.

7rjAgnw-DsHThvzf6TDBLQ.review_text: Went here for a DYL event (my first!) recently and really enjoyed this place. It is a high quality drinking establishment, with its ample standing space, plenty of seating at the long bar and cushioned seating as well (couches and such).  The only issues that I ran into was flagging down the bartenders, which I put down not to their ability but the fact that it was a long bar and lots of people waiting on drinks.  Once I did however I had a drunken conversation with one bartender who had just come off duty; another bartender came by and jumped in. Together they gave me an awesome list of bars/restaurants that aren't tourist traps in my neighborhood: North Beach (they do exist!).   Beers were reasonably priced (5 bucks a Guinness), and the only hard liquor I had was a pineapple/mango vodka infusion (chilled) was tasty, but I can't really vouch for their drinks otherwise.  Also, they're close to Golden Boy Pizza, if you get hungry.

yeUX_IIw2ysegz2k5Tjwww.review_text: I love this bar for an after-work drink on the weekdays. Even though it looks like trash on the outside, it has a very classy and aesthetic feel on the inside. Although I prefer this bar when it is a little slower, weekend nights aren't so bad either (if you can tolerate the couples making out on the couches)!   Anyways - it's definitely recommended. AND, I am super excited to go try these ribs that Vanessa is talking about! Details to come...

6ybp1lO5UkyqDHWL0bEOJA.review_text: There last night for a networking mixer.  Good to see this place is still going strong.  The food isn't bad either (for a bar that's a compliment).

1y5jl7wdDoJ3RacNAcZreA.review_text: i'll be back for sure. i mean, considering its north beach, this place has a nice dark lounge-y bar atmosphere with a up-beat crowd. i met tons of cool people that were out to have fun. Not to mention, the staff is A++. Bartenders are cool with no big egos/attitudes and if you happen to get so drunk there (say from drinking all day at pier 23 on a sunny labor day) that you forget your credit card. well, they'll keep your card in a safe place until ya regain your sobriety. thanks guys, you rock!

lDl5JBIxIZZWahib8zCIBg.review_text: Amante means lover in Espaol. Nice crowd. Stiff drinks. Friendly & efficient staff. Nice huge screens when things get boring...they won't.

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: Wow, as everyone says, this is a really chill bar.  Great variety of drinks, prompt service from the bar, and a really COOL sign outside.  And the sign is what drew me in there in the first place.  North Beach bars tend to be hit or miss on the weekends, but Amante had a very nice crowd...except for the jacka$$ that thought there was a wet t-shirt contest going on.  I don't know why else he would have spit a mouthful of water all over the front of my shirt.  I brought it to the cute bartender's attention, and they promptly threw the drunk jackass out of there!

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: Loud bar. Lots of rude people hovering over our table. Definitely a lot of drinking happening here.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: guinness $five, but $four bud light?...regular pricing steep for domestic brew...a drink and chubby noodle meal...mellow night for food and brew...tables plenty during regular pricing hours...drink orders at the table...by friendly server...northbeach gauntlet...amante....wooden aged pub along many of many saloons....one irish car bomb...3/4 pint guinness, 1/2 shot bailey and 1/2 shot jameson.....on to the next!.....or home.....

v4C8VqqXhwvP0KuhWkCL6Q.review_text: Walking around North Beach, my group and I decided to check out different places. This was one we picked because it didn't look super crowded like the place next door. The Amante is pretty spacious and had lots of available sitting for the entire group I was with. The drinks were decently priced and it was not extremely loud. Didn't have the food and looking at the pictures on Yelp made me wish we had! :(

m-2lsMLw6H140wVhGCa-Tw.review_text: Good drinks. Never been there late night, always there as a pre-going out warmup.

5iCzdzUFqbwwjgYkfr2nhA.review_text: This place is ok.  I like the ambience it has in its decor...the first thing I thought about when I came in here was holy shit! that is a big fuckin mirror over the bar.  The second thing was that if an earthquake had occured that shit would fall and hurt someone, most likely the bartenders.  This place is ok, I would like to check it out during a live performance to see how that is.  However, this trip we were working off a weird mix of music--I think someone was working off an iPod on shuffle--so the mixes were random at best.  Crowd here seems really friendly with a diverse group folks especially by age.  Bathroom is decent for a bar.  Bartenders and wait staff was nice too.  One dope plus for my visit here was that an old clown lady showed up and was making balloons for people in the room, which definitely added to the fun.  The staff at Amante should have her come more often since she livens up the place while people wait for their drinks.  Because of the weird clown lady who reminded us of the short lady from Poltergeist, I added my third star.  Pretty down to check this place out again.

oERMSLAzHBccAxuK-04ceQ.review_text: I have been raised in the eastbay however North beach is like home to to me.I know the church, I know the restaurants etc.Alot has changed from when I was young and used to hang out here.There are bars in this area that i would not step into because the people that own them are so slimy, , that I would not trust using my credit card! The owners of this bar are great  and they make a mean infused pineapple/mango vodka to die for.Try the Baja style tacos, YUM! If you want to shoot some pool go to Gino and Carlos.Check my other reviews for North Beach.I will only  tell you the ones I like because I don't want to sleep with the fishes!

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: This is a great bar, not directly on Columbus as to avoid attracting too many tourists, and very classy, in my opinion.  The thing is, it feels upscale (with all the velvet banquettes and bar stools and the gigantic mirror and high ceilings)...but it's very laid back - you don't have to dress up to come here.    The drinks are decent and I always have a good time here!

Da_ZO8lKwIacljqKUJbAlw.review_text: especially cozy after a few hours in soma.  i liked the couches and the kitchen (yay for pomme frites!)  slightly classy, but not overly so.  too bad parking in north beach sucks...

15znE0NM6nDU2oR-i5RXVA.review_text: One time I got to watch the wizard of Oz, drink cocktails, and dance with cute boys... all at one bar! It was like I had clicked my heels and come home...

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Cool bar playing top 40 hits.  The bar and chubby noodle are separate businesses.

yfG8hiLv0mA0ltTNXERuYQ.review_text: Stopped in here for a drink before they started serving food, and had a great time! The drink was good, the bar was beautiful, definitely be back to try the food!

2l9kaRFEX2w9MBL_lGzC5A.review_text: Best bar in North Beach...love the staff and the food is excellent..Try their fries. I had to ding them a point b/c they stopped showing Sex and the City on Sunday afternoons.

2l0O1EI1m0yWjFo2zSt71w.review_text: Um came here the a month ago with some old friends... after a Giants game... we had so much fun tailgating and eating suasage that we missed the frewakin' game... Hit up Amante's after and stayed there the rest of the night until it was time to go to bed... You know you had a good time in the city when you can stay at one bar and wake up in Berekley with your best girl friend from high school (c/o '98) in nothing but a shirt...

bADntnjBXIPHzFBo0RlRGA.review_text: Decent bar for a few drinks with a small group. Quick service, good atmosphere

VBteERaoP6gXcX2O0xn9SA.review_text: This is an epic bar. The service is amazing. Food is available Tuesday thru Saturday. The drinks are incredible. The bar tending is old school and friendly.   I love this place and will make it a regular hangout.

op_PKWquyGZyYQkGv9V20w.review_text: What I remember from my SF DYL at Amantes: Friendly yelpers who had no issues with fat chicks at happy hour Scrumptious pineapple infused vodka Great skinny bitches The ladies room; very Prince like Nice candle holders that look good on my desk And last but not least I learned "He who does not drink stays sober" so I drank. Good times were had for sure!

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: Came here when there was a Michigan State game.  I conveniently wore green, so I didn't stand out.  Loved the energy, but it was way too crowded!  Felt like college again.  Despite the crowd however, service was SUPER FAST.  Since it was like 4 pm on a Saturday, drinks were super cheap as well.  Even the shooters were $3 a piece :)   I was only there for 10 minutes because I couldn't handle the crowd.  It must be nice to understand football, but I don't know the rules or anything like that.    From the outside, it looked like a cafe because there were a couple tables outside where people were just eating.  It's deceiving!  Inside, the decor is actually quite nice compared to what it looks like on the outside, too.

3XChzdVSI4aoXjr8YTx_KA.review_text: You know those movies, where someone stands at a piano singing, then another person gets up and sings, and some people are dancing, and you think "wow, wouldn't it be cool if life was really like that?" Because I don't know about you, but when I go to parties, no one is standing around a piano singing.  This bar is the equivalent of that movie, and it's great.    Went here last Sunday to see Carol Doda perform.  What a great show. She sang, then another guy who reminds me of a sexier Martin Landau sang, then a woman from the audience sang (although really, no white lady can pull off Birth of the Blues, I'm sorry.  Her voice was beautiful, but that is just not a song for anyone but Sammy).  Then a couple got up and danced.  Then the guy from that couple sang O Sole Mio.  What a great, and wildly entertaining night.  It's nice to find a bar that's not overrun with mannerless frat boys in flip flops and their equally ill-dressed sorority friends.  This is a place for grownups.  Grownups who want great drinks and great entertainment in a really cool, old-school atmosphere.  Oh, and Willie Brown had a book signing here one evening.  I think that really says it all.

IDVX4Is4CanREchBmpFXoA.review_text: A classy and spacious North Beach joint, I really like the setting of this place, with its enormous mirrors strategically placed around the room for maximum bizzel-scoping, and the amber-backlit liquor bottles set on the perch behind the bar.  The only thing I didn't really appreciate was the enormous pink and purple neon sign glaring out from the corner exclaiming "Hungry? Our kitchen is open!"

wb2I6PxYjRStE7OGLL4S7A.review_text: Me: "I need a drink...it's been a loooong freakin' month" Mike G.: "It's a Wednesday night, you have problems" Me: "I don't care if I have to go sit at a bar by myself, I'm getting wasted tonight"  Mike G.: "Alright, I'll go out for one, but that's it" ........... 3 hours later....  Mike G.: "This place is AWESOME...I'M SO GLAD WE CAME HERE!!"  That's right folks, Amante changes lives. Well at least it spruces up an otherwise dull Wednesday night. The live band that plays every Wednesday was actually pretty good and the lead singer had me up off my ass and shakin' it on the dance floor. The place was otherwise pretty dead with just a few other random locals, which is to be expected I suppose on a Wed. night. Either way....Amante was just what I needed to boost my spirits!  Amante is a nice alternative to the other dive bars (not that there's anything wrong with said dive bars) in the area with their plush couches, deliscious cocktails and sexed up bar scene.

G63Z9erAE8uVnh4pnG7Yyg.review_text: This is a wonderful actually to me was a neighborhood bar when I lived there. The bartenders always remember you. Even after being away for almost a year they all remembered me, when I dropped in to visit. Great crew, and they will take care of all your needs. A night out gets no better then Amante.

hSD2Lu8Z_62klnMDND5sSg.review_text: Amante:  Means lover in espanol.  I love this place. I haven't been in so long and I just revisited it not too long ago. Unfortunately it doesn't pack them in like it used to when i first move here, but decor is so cute, and dim, and the bartenders are SO nice and attentive (you are get great service). Boy do they know how to make a drink, and the pineapple infused vodka -- wow -- two of my favorite things TOGETHER!  They also serve food, and from what I have had it was pretty tasty. Check it out.  P.S.  Try to get the window seat and the front and draw the curtains closed - if you can!

vYbkZwjGS2DJySnPZM_C1A.review_text: Ok place. Is fun on a busy weekend night, but definitely gets a bit crowded. best part is that they are close to golden boys

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: This bar is fun. Never douchey, great mix of people, cheap drinks, tvs so you can watch the game(s)  ... I spent NYE here and there was even a balloon and confetti drop! I totally didn't expect it...  Just get better bathrooms PLEASE. There is only ONE TOILET with a weird velour curtain. I don't want to even think about what type of germs are incubating on that thing because it probably hasn't been washed in ages.  This is the worst thing about this place. The line starts looking like the line for Ike's sandwiches. Ladies, why the hell do you take so long!? Drop your panties, do your biz, wipe the taco, pull your pants up, flush, wash hands YOU LOOK CUTE YOU DON'T NEED TO REDO YOUR MAKEUP gtfo!.   Otherwise, I dig this spot.

M_SxfmZjepJYxE_vNbWK4g.review_text: Whenever my friends and I go out without a plan or a particular place in mind, Amante is where we'll gravitate towards. Amante has been the start and an end to many memorable nights. Alfredo and Wiz are super cool people that always take care of us while tending to the rest of the bar, so you never have to wait long for a drink! And when it's slow, they let me make my own =) When the kitchen's open, be sure to try the fish tacos and fries, it'll compliment any drink you're having.   The crowd ranges from older locals to the limited but present bridge and tunneler's to the stripe shirts who've lost their way to the Marina. And then there's us.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: "Decent bar and decent bar food- pizza and fries are actually quite good. Kinda dirty though. But central location"

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: The waitress doesn't know how to prioritize with accompanying groups when they want to be seated while there are 2 reserved tables put on hold and we were eyeing those 2 spots for a good 20 minutes.  It's common sense to just get us seated and forfeit at least 1 of the reserved tables.  It was after 8pm on a Wednesday and surely almost everyone has had their group dinner by that time.  Her excuse was that those 2 tables are reserved for big parties.  We asked if the parties called in for reservations and she said no.  What the heck!  So it is unclaimed while we were waiting and hungry.    The only reason why I brought my girls to this place on a hump day is their combination of a bar scene with Chubby Noodle as their food vendor.  Other than that, we could have grabbed our drinks somewhere else.   Amante's Pink Drink, Margarita and Sidecar were all cocktail drinks that were decently priced.  Still not great to outweigh the service.

r0E3thgIfJm6S_jaUznL5A.review_text: This place is nice. I can actualy hear what people are saying to me. It's more of a chill night life. Everyone is always friendly.  I like to start off drinking here. A great place to meet up at too.

zyNGr5Tlg1rK1frevXCx2g.review_text: I love Amante, but I'm biased since I absolutely love Wizz (Mike too).    Amante has been one of my 'go-to' spots for a few years now. It's a great intimate space. Some nights it's packed, others it's nice and mellow the way a lounge should be. The drinks are always solid and I can never get enough of the pineapple infused vodka on the rocks. The drinks are poured heavy and are cheap compared to other bars in the city.   Last night I threw a party here for the first time and had an incredible time. It's a great venue for small parties if you want a lot of room to move around or larger parties (100+) if you want to keep things comfy and cozy .   The best thing on the food menu are the fish tacos...  Thanks Wizz!!  1-800-COLLECT

tV7_Prku_wwOnjSz-8-4tw.review_text: We stopped in for a drink and some appetizers before a show.  Not too many people around at first but it started filling up with groups of people coming in all at once.  They have lots of group tables/areas.    Upscale modern decor, ala dark wood and stained glass.  It's nice, makes it definitely not a dive bar.  Great wine list, and great appetizers.  The spicy/sweet shrimp was awesome, and I usually don't like shrimp, or spicy for that matter. But I would defiantly get that dish again.  The chicken skewers were big hunks of well marinated, tender chicken.  And the fish tacos were equally as delish as the other two dishes.  I seem to be on a role lately of meeting bar/restaurant owners!  This owner served us our drinks.  Very nice, down to earth guy who knows his business inside and out.  It's no wonder the place is a success when you meet him.

b-1dsipvOL7X79xmUaz9QQ.review_text: Wizzy, Michael & Alfredo? BEST! BEST! BEST! i love the hamburger ;).

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: Came here with the Sottomare crowd and the bartender and doorman were funny and nice.  Not sure on the cocktails since I had shots but the music was good.  Danced a little salsa and it was fun.  Some people were just sitting and catching up.  We were probably one of the most obnoxious ones there...
