9j3EILvGpHgoOy70rIP4XA.review_text: There are many times that I wish I was better with names, and this visit to Amante was one of them.  I came here for pre-dinner drinks on my birthday, so the place was fairly empty.  I love the interior!    But even better was the service I received - our bartender (I unfortunately don't remember his name, or maybe I even forgot to ask) was great!  My boyfriend asked for a particular cocktail, but since the bar didn't have one of the key ingredients, Mr. Bartender whipped up an even yummier drink.  As I sipped my gin and tonic, I even contemplated asking for the same drink my boyfriend got, but I had already given him enough crap about ordering fruity drinks.  =)

In-jPXAVKHLbR_7pjESGPA.review_text: Friendly accommodating and warm with great background music.Nice nite cap spot in North beach..plus Eric (bartender) laughed at my jokes

woW3EEoyj5M42Z7yXLhNLg.review_text: Any place that puts up with my high-maintenance ass deserves 5 stars, but I'd give more to Amante if I could. I hosted my 25th birthday party here on Saturday, and at the risk of sounding like an over-excited frat boy (Hi Keith Charles!) it was EPIC. I knew I'd found my venue after corresponding with Amante's events guy, the aptly named Wizz, when he promised he'd personally see to it that the playlist excluded Journey and Def Leppard (there's a reason I didn't choose a Marina bar, after all). The rest of the staff was equally accommodating and attentive- huge props to our cocktail waitress Emilie and all the bartenders for making sure all my guests were (over)served. Thanks so much for coming out friends, it was truly a night to remember... in pictures anyway.

VlVx6clfF7iZfO_idvuMfA.review_text: Stopped in here again.. It was NYD, and the nearby bars we usually go to while waiting for seats at Tony's, were all closed.  The place was busy, but we easily got seats away from most of the TV's and sports fans.  Our friends hadn't been here before, and I think they had a good time as well.  The owner did decide to close early, but not before making us all another drink and chatting a bit.  Lots of eating, nice bar area, well made drinks and reasonably priced.  Definitely adding it to the rotation when we're nearby.

IxKjgqLAG6teY_pqGnh9ZQ.review_text: May 11, 2007 @ 7:30pm: Kicked off the birthday pub crawl with a shot of fernet!  As the rest of the party chilled at Golden Boy with pizza and the Warriors game, Jenny and I sneaked out for a bit to get fernets at Amante.   Nice open space, clean, good crowd and nice bar stools and booths!   One of the bartender was not very nice, but maybe that's because one of my co-worker was using her megaphone inside the bar.  The bartender was slightly annoyed.  Oh well, he didn't get a tip.    Would probably go here again to chill with a big group of friends because I've never really seen it very crowded.  Plus, they have food -- gotta try the food here sometime soon :-)!  Fernet count at Amante: 3 = 3 initials on the my right arm to keep track of how many I drink.   1 from Jenny @ 7:30p 1 from Linda/Ronnie @ 7:55p 1 from Kitty/Keiko @ 8:10p

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Alright, I'm going to let you in on this...Amante's Happy Hour!  I missed it but hubby gave his thumbs up.    When:  Monday to Friday Time:   4-8pm (yes, you can make it without rushing from work) What:   $3 draft and well drinks AND $2 special apps Apps:   $2 gives you a choice of pulled pork taco, lamb slider or chicken skewer  What does this mean - 2 drinks and 2 apps  for $10, feeling good and tummy is full.    See you there!

KIUeZpqA5DpQZIhcBwQVvQ.review_text: Always a fun night out at Amante.. we usually stop in for a couple of drinks and end of staying until closing. The crowd is cool and the drinks are strong (what more could you want!)  Not too big of a fan of the live band that was playing there a couple of months ago when we went, but there is normally pretty decent music playing.  My only concern is the washroom- in the women's restroom there is a curtain instead of a stall door and you are constantly worried that someone is going to barge in while you are in there!

GHZdMggvuYk1fsVWcyy0JQ.review_text: I like this place. The bartenders are friendly even when they're busy and their drinks are pretty stiff. The crowd is pretty chill and there's a minimum of the drunken shenanigans that are found frequently at other North Beach bars.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: i spent one of my birthdays here partying with all my friends. we actually scored the long velvety couch towards the back even though it was a packed mad-house that night. we celebrated drinking champagne till the wee hours and then happily staggered home. i actually prefer this bar when its quiet (mid-week and off hours) because its just one of those bars where you don't notice how pretty it is till its empty.

w5x0EU9mkxJt4_1kGZhe4g.review_text: We stopped in here for a before dinner drink, and liked it so much that we stopped back again for an after-dinner one as well.  The place has a really good atmosphere -both cozy and fun.  Besides the bar  seating, there are comfortable booths.  We also discovered a new beer.  Haywire wheat - on draft.  Kind of like Blue Moon, but better.  We didn't try the food, but really liked the place.  Private parking lot across the street - 20 bucks - but better than driving around for an hour looking for a place.

OtTWaoUGz-kT0kPGV5MP8g.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
OtTWaoUGz-kT0kPGV5MP8g.review_text: I love coming to Amante when I want a more refined experience in my hood. I love the band that comes in every third Sunday and with the new outside tables for people watching and smoking, adds more reason why I love coming over. The infused martinis were great too.  The people are great, you get to dancing with strangers and see some sights with some of the locals getting away from the frat scene. The bartenders are great, they seem the old school type that actually talk and listen to you while giving you stiff drinks...that's character man!  The last time I was there, there was an older gentleman that can not only put away alcohol but dance, and I mean the bodybending, hipbreaking variety of Latin dancing. I was scared for him but coming here is always a random experience when he also came back in with a cockatoo! Like after some dancing to summon the damn bird, he goes out to do his birdcall only to have it perch on his arm and brings it back into the bar to meet the whole gang. WTH?!  Yeah, that's Amante for you.  The burgers are pretty good too, have yet to venture through the menu.

qKgy1I7PcGTh9hd5ujhPNg.review_text: I came to Amante, mainly to see Shota Osabe, a friend who plays the best jazz piano around.  Through him, I've come to know some fabulous singers and the night I went to Amante, he was part of the band performing for hot, sexy Latin singer and dancer, Valeriana Quevedo.  That, in itself, was worth the drive from Daly City and the interminable search for a parking place in North Beach!  Luckily, I found handicapped parking just around the corner from Amante and, after offering thanksgiving to the gods, had one of the best evenings of my life!  The music was hot, the joint was jumping and I had some of the best fish tacos ( reasonably priced ) I'd ever eaten.  The menu had a good selection of items, none of them outrageous in price, and there was an interesting assortment of cocktails ( I had some sort of lychee martini which I enjoyed immensely ).  People danced and Valeriana had as much fun as the customers.  For a minute, I thought she was going to salsa out the door and off into the wilds of North Beach.  Certainly, Amante's is not your stuck up ritzy joint but I found it a fun spot to spend an evening....if just the darn parking were easier!

gqZvcNfUYWFsZNiZXfS4fA.review_text: yeah, a little bridge and tunnel-esque...but i always somehow end up having a hilariously delightful time at amante. there are just some characters all up in this place. and people who can't dance, but dont care.

tfO4ZEAnFdry8cOC-ZoHMg.review_text: I've been to Amante many times and have always like the bar and music. Wizz, the owner, was extremely helpful in reserving a section for my husband's 30th birthday - free of charge! He was super helpful in making sure we had everything that we needed and couldn't have been nicer. I would definitely recommend having an event here and look forward to going back soon.

-AsU15jw64vw1o5gCievpQ.review_text: Fabulous spot with decently priced drinks and a great ambiance. Plenty of seating, great tunes, fabulous drinks.  It draws a local crowd which I appreciate, as many North Beach bars can get a bit too touristy for my taste.  I simply adore Amante..... and frequently pop in for a taste of their scrumptious homemade pineapple infused vodka, and a visit with my favorite local bartender, Eric.  Love him. Now... if they could only add a second bathroom stall.................

zwLq4aVDSH7HyMbVjKfkRg.review_text: Wiz and Michael have made Amante a "landmark" in North Beach.  Beside the cocktails, the bar food challenges many restaurants in the area. Wings, fish tacos, and pizza (from the wood oven) are perfect! And the french fries are the best!

1f33vJNISFbw0GaMYpEncw.review_text:
After 5 drinks, I offered the pony-tailed bartender some of my leftover tortellini from Mona Lisa while he was pouring drinks. When we were getting ready to leave, he came up to me at the table where my friends and I were sitting and apologized he couldn't eat any! HAHAHAHA! 
  The martinis are bigger here than O'Reilly's and probably only $1-2 more. Dave says that you're supposed to sip martinis, but I like to take a mouthful in and swallow a little at a time.
  The ladies room has 1 toilet and a curtain instead of a door, so be mindful if it's drawn shut. In my drunken stupor, I dragged it open and saw a girl sitting on the pot. Oops.

jX52sZoojxyYV2viWNyO7A.review_text: Amante is a smallish but cool bar.  They have a huge amazing mirror behind the bar that seriously adds a lot of visual depth to the place.   The drinks are decent.  I'm just not too keen on the vibe.  The women here are just looking for some rich sugar daddies and the men are slimey.  They take a number to pick up on the few chicks stupid enough to walk into this bar.  It's like watching scavengers feed on carrion.  Entertaining, but really fucking tragic..  Come here on a slow weekday night though (say Tuesday) and this place is yours... On those days, Amante gets the 4 stars.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: When this place is not crazy busy, it's basically a nice place to grab a drink and have a conversation. The drinks are decently priced and it's located next to a bunch of other notable places like Sotto Mare or Golden Boy Pizza. I highly recommend this joint for anyone's bar hopping list.  Grab a bite from Chubby Noodle inside this joint for some pricey "modernized" food.

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: It's alright...I've never been here on a normal night.  It's either one of two things...  Empty: *cricket* *cricket*  or  Packed: Guys "accidentally" grabbing my ass.  The drinks are okay, the place is nice, the people are not so nifty most of the time...But it all gets better when you're trashed, but so do most places.  Eh...*shrugs shoulders*

s16-BUo-orUsELvMu5ocKg.review_text: If you can snag a table on the front, hunker down under the generous heat lamps and enjoy people-watching. My friend and I stopped here for a drink and really enjoyed the chill atmosphere. Service was pretty slow at first but got better after we placed our orders. I got the Infused Martini and she got the North Beach Iced Tea. Both were pretty good but I liked my martini better.   You will definitely see characters if you stay here long enough. I think my favorite was the guy dressed like a pimp for no apparent reason.

QssxvL783zOoKPrrkusiog.review_text: Amante is one of those places that you can walk into anytime of day and tie one on... It's got a great old school local crowd during the day and a cool new school local crowd in the evenings. The food is nothing to rave about but it's not bad either. They always have the games on, they have live bands every now and then and the bartenders are always welcoming and friendly.

XE8Jc_84wybVBP8k1HcmPA.review_text: I like this place, but that might have been purely because I saw a bunch of people I hadn't seen in the last 8 months and I have missed them so much and the entire night was so wonderful. I must say that the drinks were quite weak, but I don't think they were highly priced. I did have one ridiculously strong gin and tonic that Gabriel bought for me, so it was free and strong and made up for the rest.

MU_bppwgP03jfpTo6vtZ5w.review_text: I woulda given this place 5 stars my first 5 visits.. But that last time... Well gee.. When its the owner who ruins it for you.. Ouch..  I was a server bartender for years.. I only VERY recently became a corporate hotshot..   I was in, again, with the crowd getting off work from group of employees from a nearby restaurant. Although this time i arrived with a friend not the gang ad we had bar seats..  I hadvalways been welcome to bring my ten pound dog previously. Typically she stays in the bag i bring her in dozing.   We must if spent $150 & tipped almost $100- bartenders do that.- plus the  discounts were alright. But we knew it was the owner so we were cool.  Suddenly someone notices Madison who will always look like a puppy, and for @5 min she was passed about the bar..  Apparently someone complained. Cuz we were thrown out by the owner we had just spent a bunch $$$$ on. No explanation. Just bye now you with the dog.  Jerk.

QOMoA_G5PBrUA_WXu1ZdIg.review_text: Nice and cozy bar - great service. Needs some refreshment though, feels little funky to be inside. But its common for most old bars I guess, they never do renovations unless the ownership change.

-1Grce7VmCft_uq79JX9Ow.review_text: Decent place. First time trying a kimchee hot dog, it was delicious ! Chill music but hate looking for parking in this area.

s6xZpSHNteqqsLzuC3Jd8A.review_text: Don't come here just for Chubby Noodle (even though it's hella good), but make sure to drink up at the bar as well. Our bartender was fast, friendly and most importantly, attentive. This is so much more than just a convenient place to wait for a table to open up at Sotto Mare. Plus, the music is phenomenal. Snooooooop (Lion?)!

hFvLaKDNHMxHze13Hd-FZQ.review_text: Do you LOVE watching cougars attack their prey? How about pineapple infused vodka (yes, it's sooooooooo trendy)? Or what about LIVE music on a Wednesday evening? If so, then Amante is the place for you.  Came here on the eve of New Year's eve with a group of college friends. It was surprisingly bumping, the drinks were tasty and reasonably priced, and the young and old were tearing up the dance floor.   The *older* lady in the red dress with the dynamo bod was like a car accident--I couldn't stop staring. Whoa mama. Literally.

5RCcFwMRghhw1wMhnZY5RA.review_text: Love. This. Place!  The staff are very friendly, and courteous. I recommend this place to anyone who loves having a good time. Drinks are Delish as well!  Two Thumbs Up!

3zETQEZrHiJNE38RFT8eNw.review_text: Nice place. Judging by the sort-of-retro sign outside, I almost was expecting flappers and velvet couches. I got my couches, plus a huge TV screen. The pony-tailed bartender handled my friend's special requests without any hassle. He was cool. What's with the music, though? I'm not sure we're far enough in the 2000s to be playing some of the "classics" of the mid-90s as the Thursday night soundtrack.

bMb2_rO8hMJbJAFne7ulMA.review_text: We went mid week, and it was very laidback and relaxed.  The barstaff kept checking to see how we were doing, which I liked. Music was a little depressing though.

AJmUkS2J_HVr-HTUoFTxrw.review_text: I just met one of the owners of Amante and he is the cat's meow...!  The thing about bars in SF is they are trying to out-do one another with music, decor, "signature" cocktails, back-flippin' bartenders...oh, sorry that was a movie...Amante is NOT trying to be anything, but what it is:  a great place to hang out and take shots of tequila, or Fernet, whatever.    Don't look for ambient Buddha Bar, or Om lounge music to set the pace--what you'll get is rock -n-roll, Guns and Roses, or Prince if you're nice to Wiz, the charming owner with all-american-boy good looks...Good eats, stiff drinks, and even a little dancing.  It's a perfect place to get a taste of good ole North Beach hospitality.

mO5VWLI4iVf5o7ghJqGtUQ.review_text: I've always had fun here whether it was a monday or a saturday. Just a great place to relax with friends and drinks. Their restroom is pretty cool with the swinging purple curtain door. I wonder if the men's restroom is just as cool...

riKNIk-BcVqX7oDFq_B3Fw.review_text: LOVED the atmosphere. Its a dark bar thats lively enough to not make you feel like a lone alcoholic sitting at the bar but chill enough where you're not in constant fear of rowdy 20-somethings busting out body shots next to you (an experience I'll have to share another time). The bartenders pour with a strong hand and the drinks come out delicious. The waitresses are a little on the pushy side, as our table was checked on 4 times after we had said we were done and just winding down before hitting the road, which gave us the impression that we were being pushed out. But nonetheless, the place is fun and the drinks are great.

ii6JkzDO5eWHxNA1SeTuJQ.review_text: The bartenders pour a mighty good drink and are very friendly.  Its a very chill atmosphere and they now have a pop-a-shop noodle/fried chicken offerings.  I've been going here for years and would recommend.

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: came here for anna's birthday. i love the north beach area, and definitely enjoyed my first time at this bar. it's pretty dark in there. even when they "turned on the lights" at last call, it was still dark. but i love bars like that. there's a lot of seating at the bar, a few tables, and a few couches. we had most of the couches for our gigantic group. there is also plenty of standing room to mingle or wander around.  the drinks were pretty cheap. $4 for a beer, $5.50 for well drinks. not bad on a saturday night in north beach. the bartenders were cool and it was never hard to get a drink. the cocktail waitress was sweet, came around often, and always asked if we were doing ok. the bouncer was also cool, even lighting our cigs everytime we went out for a smoke. they also serve food here, although i didn't eat. but the menu looked solid and the food some people were eating smelled good.   there were plenty of plasma's and a projector screen, showing the WBC and sportscenter. cant complain with that.. the bathroom situation was the opposite of most places. the girls never had a line the whole night, while the guys line was constantly 4 or 5 deep. this is because there was only 1 stall for the men. but most men, like myself, are in and out within 45 seconds. so it was all good...  great bar, great area, great crowd. we were even treated to a near sex-show involving the sparkely-dress girl. i will definitely be back. hopefully next time, i am not at a 10(on the drunk scale), so i can actually be coherent...

nlOxarS20luHkAloH5YyzA.review_text: OH MY GOD...their baby back ribs are AMAZING!  I don't know what kind of BBQ sauce they use, but it is so, so, so good.  It's spicy and thick and tangy and bold.  The meat just falls off the bone and melts in your mouth.  I'm salivating.  I want more.  One plate is not enough.    This is a fun bar.  They have bands play like Petty Theft (An amazing Tom Petty cover band), they have Jager girls, they have fruit infused vodka!    Minus one star for a weird bathroom.  They have a curtain, not a door.  Plus one star for there being a line for the men's and not for the women's.    Minus a star for, no offense, it being a lot of foreigners.  North Beach is a tourist trap where men from England, Australia, and Ireland come to hang out.  I can't go to a bar in North Beach without everyone I meet being on holiday.

FjNgN6Dk9fh4NatwthoFgA.review_text: I went to this bar with a bunch of law students on a weeknight... really great decor and ambiance, and good drinks. I didn't get to taste the food, but their fries looked yummy.

NPRyDEG1D2taLdbdXhrNlA.review_text: We were looking for a place where we could sit at the bar and have a drink with a cool bartender and people. We found it. This is a really cool bar that is very long. Nothing fancy, just nice regulars, a television at both ends and any drink you could want. Just a nice place to spend an hour or so.

VMakUjCziVNgLdsmoTj9-Q.review_text: The perfect place to start when you're going out in North Beach. Have a few pineapple-infused vodkas and you will be good to go for the night. So amazing.

0mmu5ME29Y8vLr9wyEvTKQ.review_text: One of my favorite little northbeach spots. It has a slightly more upscale feel than the other north beach options so you don't feel silly stopping in all decked out if you're on your way to dinner or somewhere more dressy as you may in a lot of the bars around since they're all really casual. They usually play pretty fun music. I love the big mirror and beautiful A behind the bar. There's not really a dance floor at all, but there's often times when everyone's just dancing whereever their standing.  I threw a surprise party for my husband here a few years ago and they did a great job of getting us the plates and cake supplies on the spur of the moment when we showed up with just a cake not thinking about the other details like forks, plates napkins etc. The place always has people in it but it's never jam packed so you can always find somewhere to sit which is nice.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Can't say I'm a huge fan, but: they have Mirror Pond on tap, and Chubby Noodle is here.

GMiMXVIv9y5gpF95WCBZEQ.review_text: My girlfriends and I used to frenquent Amante very often.  Back when they had Sex and the City nights on Sunday with $4 cosmos. Before Scott quit to open his bar ACES. We used to have brunch at Delucchi bloody mary's at O'Rielly's and the stagger to Amante. We would hang out with Scott and Eric from 4 in the afternoon untill we dropped.  Many fond memories of Vodka Pineapple martini's yummy salty fries and eating all their garnishes. Mid evening it wasn't odd to find one of us passed out in the window cubby area or behinde the bar. An evening of debuachery ending with only a $40 bar tab? Hum, it's a wonder they didn't go out of business.    I've been a couple times recently, it's just so crowded and very meatmarketish. But, Eric makes a mean Level dirty martini, served witha side of a olives of course!

oUK6Xs5dPPnP4whFeZExGg.review_text: I'll have a cocktail with a side of cocktail please.  San Francisco bars, I feel like if any of them were to make a crappy cocktail, they wouldn't last longer than a fly on honey. I don't think that will be Amante. At least not from my Old Fashioned and my Vieux Carré.  I enjoyed the vibe here. Buzzing but not crowded. Upbeat but not overwhelming. The right amount of noise level but I could still hear my Friday eve shenaniganners from across the table.  We only stayed for the two drinks. There were other sights to be seen. But one drink ordered from the bar, one from our server at the table, both an experience that wouldn't say no to venturing back for.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: I stopped in to meet a friend for a pre-dinner drink. The place was pretty empty. The bartender was really cool..knows when to be attentive and when to leave you alone.  It was nice to go somewhere in North Beach not filled with tourists.

SIcy7NV7ZSUCrM3i9l3jLg.review_text: The pineapple-infused martini was kind of amazing. The bachelorette party next to us did not significantly detract from my enjoyment of the evening. I will probably be back.

t5AFrfee1pFSgVQ8Bb05Ug.review_text: This place is really close to my apt but I'd never been there because one of my staple going out buddies doesn't really like it. I thought it was fine...we only had 1 drink here but the music seemed fun- which can make or break a place for me. I will have to check it out again when I am not already tired-- and when it has more of a crowd too to give it a more well-rounded review.

re6fN6eb3NTL7hKK-5CYUQ.review_text: This is my favorite bar in North Beach.  I am addicted to their Pineappletini and I think it's great that they have Chubby Noodle for some savory treats (you can't go wrong with their fried chicken!). The cocktail servers bring your drinks very fast and the bartenders are down to earth and friendly. The front door bouncers are pretty nice as well.  The clientele are just normal people (thankfully we don't get too many douchebags here--if you like them, go to The Marina district). The music selection is pretty good. The bathrooms are clean (well, at least whenever I go it's always been clean) and the booths are pretty comfy. I appreciate the fact that the staff keeps the bar clean.  I say this because I noticed that the tables are never sticky.  I will definitely consume at least 100 more Amante Pineappletinis by the end of this year!

NSCy54eWehBJyZdG2iE84w.review_text: I go to Amante every Thursday before work (I bartend @ Columbus Cafe) Just for the Fish Tacos. They are the closest I can find to the ones A San Felipe grill in stockton.  The fish is perfect, with a white sauce (sour cream, mayo, lime maybe?) pico de gallo, shredded cabbage, lime. Off the hook.   I hear the ribs are great too.

3ZAt86qNiV4oWK9jkClFFg.review_text: Whiz and the other bartenders are fabulous!  Their kitchen serves some hot and consistently good bar food.  Try the wings!!! Yum! The guys serve up great drinks of a substantial size.  It's a friendly neighborhood bar with a bit of an up-scale-y feel.

WJDPbSUSiSohQ6R6Ku4wFA.review_text: I stumbled in here by accident when I was waiting for Magnet to open and was really impressed. It was pretty quiet at 7pm on a Saturday which is fine by me. Plenty of comfy couchy areas to sit - huge cielings give an airy feel. I was craving fries so I ordered at the bar along with a coke which I quickly changed to a jack & coke cuz it seemed like the right thing to do. The order of fries was mega huge in a spiralling wrought iron conical container. I'll definitely come back with a larger group.

LPkh_eURB6fOA1w7GSf1qA.review_text: We walked in here on accident. I was looking for Columbus Cafe, but I saw this place had the ball game on and two open seats at the bar, so I beelined it. My poor husband caught up to me and whispered in my ear that it was the wrong place. Hey, they had frenet too, so all wasn't lost. I also tried the pineapple martini. The first one was okay, but for the second one, I asked him to put a shot of pineapple juice in with it, and that was BOMB. It's pretty loud with mediocre music and the average age goes up as the night wears on. When we first walked in, there were a bunch of twenty-somethings dressed in 80's garb. As it got later, the 40 and 50- year olds came out to play. Fun stop and if you don't like it, you can always go next door.

arY2V-MtKksRAoqd-dVYOQ.review_text: Average bar to me. Bartenders were nice, and of course asked us if we needed more drinks when our glasses looked empty. Crowd seemed to be the mid-late twenties and up. Some interesting folks here and there, but to be honest have no idea what some other yelpers mean with the B&T crowd-guess I haven't been here long enough. The music included Madonna (90s version), Naughty by Nature's OPP (yeah you know me) and some other 90s stuff. Then all of a sudden, the music switched to Missy Elliot, Outkast, Ja Rule, etc. Decor is interesting, you have ESPN and Golf TV playing, some large Skyy and Ketel One bottles displayed above your head, along with some musical gear above the doorway. It's pretty dark inside, save for the lights emanating from the televions. Not a big place where it's required to dress up but you could if you really wanted to.

wMEw-gWMgKvrSa0KgysZGQ.review_text: I agree with the people who labeled this an average bar.  Probably a 3 1/2 stars rather then a three.  It wasn't anything really special.  A few good things that i liked about this bar was the relaxed atmosphere, chill bartenders, and the big tv's showing sports (when we were there).    The drinks aren't anything unique or different and if you ask me...are about average price of any other bar that you find in North Beach.    One thing i found surprising about this place was the clean bathroom lol.  It doesn't happen often in a bar, but this time that we went the bathroom was clean and well stocked.    The real reason to come here is if your looking for a place to drink with comfy couches to kick back on.  Like i said before, the prices are pretty average, not to say they are more or less then other bars, but really just run of the mill, middle road prices.    Average Bar that has a nice atmosphere.  Worth a visit when u wanna just have a few drinks and kick back

aei-4QBYVdUAcQOyu9jSGQ.review_text: What a gross establishment.  None of us had ever been here before, and we'll never go back.  I'm not ageist, but 50+ year old men should not be groping 20-something females as soon as they walk through the door.  "There must be a beauty factory outside," as an unsolicited hand snakes around my friend's waist.  Disgusting.  We left and took 8 steps next door to the Columbus Cafe and had a great time.

uS5n9LYDAChLdsFQO5HUmA.review_text: If I could take a bath in their pineapple martini I would. OMG - so good. This place has a great vibe, super comfy booths that are situated higher up so you can see all the action and everyone who works here is a total sweetheart. Love that you don't have to go anywhere except across the bar to the Chubby Noodle window for high quality (Mary's organic chicken!) snack to go with your drink. I'm a fan!

LRJgblf3U3v1MwhR7GrnfA.review_text: Have been going to this bar off and on over the last several years, consistently a nice crowd in here, bartenders' r great, fun place to hang.  A place to relax and have a good time, no pressure, no scene...

rDTr5r0xEMpQpkPphe66KQ.review_text: Take off your glasses, you are indoors.

kORGcgi0Iw2RG8gJl84MVA.review_text: I had a great night here. The staff, as far as I can tell, is almost entirely well-worn 40 something men who are sort of harley davidson but with a bit of class and sugar. The bartenders are fantastic and the bouncer is funny and friendly. Pat, the bartender with the long ponytail, is very nice and makes awesome cocktails.   It was easy to push in and get a seat, even though the bar was hopping and pretty busy. I really liked the crowd that this place brought--serious, not too trendy, but fun-loving, save for a few frat boy types that somehow ended up here and tried to tell me that because I asked for a cigarette for my friend (since I don't smoke and she is shy) that I would have to do some sort of sexual favor ("do all of us"), which one of them first said would have to be done to his friend who gave me the cigarette, and then he changed his mind and said "all of us," circling his hand around to about five men around him, all of whom were much more attractive than him, and who were not seconding his suggestion. I sort of told him to screw off and he did. Misogynistic asshole.   Overall then people are interesting and nice, though, but a few too many foreigners here for a regular sort of spot. It's a once in a while place. The bar itself was scattered with cute Australian men the night I was there, save for the eldest of them who was a bit creepy and invited me to have a seat. Luckily I already had one elsewhere and was passing by.  Drink prices were good, too. $6 for a sidecar served up tasty like a sweet tart with a sugared martini rim.

a_6G0FFvG2dzQTGULfYOzQ.review_text: this is NOT a dive bar.  in case you were wondering.

_lbgVbWTvxV9VTVWU0YnwA.review_text: It's a pretty nice lil spot.  Not to crazy busy... not exactly dead and boring.  I go there often enough.  It's a nice bar with some decent apps.  Try out the Calamari.  Yum.

oavPd3eVwL0N8Y4t3WvrBw.review_text: I love the live music here on Sundays....and the calamari....and the ribs....and the el gato negro cabernet sauvignon....and the matchbooks.....and throwing aforementioned matchbooks at obnoxious-looking-people....and denying throwing matchbooks at obnovious-looking-people...

1wI3WRmx5IMOmxVx8k1Wrg.review_text: I recently came across this place when meeting a buddy for a drink. It's located in North Beach on Green street by Golden Boy pizza. We actually came here for the noodles  at Chubby Noodle, which is located inside the bar. I've walked by this place a million times and it never occurred to me that there's small restaurant within the bar. We came for the noodles but stayed for the drinks once we realized what a cool bar this is.  For starters, the staff is very very friendly. I met who I assume is the owner when we sat down. I'll review the noodles another time as this bar definetely deserves some attention.  The coolest thing about this place is that they infuse their own vodka. The time I was here it was pineapple infused and it was absolutely delicious. I'm a huge vodka fan and usually drink it straight or martini style so I was really pleasantly surprised. I've had flavored and home infused vodka before. I was just kind in shock that a local dive type bar would go through the trouble of doing this. It's not a complicated process at all, but It's cool that a business chooses to distinguish themselves from the herd.  We were there for a couple of hours and I will definitely  go back. The bartender was really nice and the mix of people that trickled in as the night progressed was pretty cool. Not too many douchebags and a nice mix of good looking women. All in all we had a great time and I was actually surprised by the atmosphere considering the touristy location. The fact that we could also snack on some pretty awesome noodles and other good fare didn't hurt.

k6zYbMle3LI9jhMuY4Tc4w.review_text: Not fancy, not a dive bar. Best part of this bar is the Chubby Noodle food (separate review). But they also have very good prices for drinks, especially for this neighborhood. The house made pineapple infused vodka is tasty and something different from the usual, though that's really the only thing on the drink menu that was unique. They also have some good seating options: high tables with views of TVs (good for game watching), a comfy booth/table with curtains near the door (though not good if you're tired--I fell asleep there once), and outdoor tables that make for great people watching on this section of Green.

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: Being right down the street from home, this bar serves as a good happy hour spot. A mellow Friday evening with some lovely Yelp buddies, I enjoyed the early evening crowd.   At 6pm there was plenty of comfy seating, no loud music to shout over, and several big screen tvs to view the baseball game. I had no problem ordering my drink, which a rum & diet coke ran me roughly $6. Not too bad, and the bartender was quick to serve me. If you want some snacks to go with your munchies, they have appetizer dishes as well.   The crowd was a mix, and I actually enjoyed the fact that I could have a decent conversation with friends, unlike the usual loud bar shouting scene. No thrilling stories attached this review, but just the pure facts of Amante :)

U7HvQlvV8b_-VjuqkJ4WqA.review_text: Amante is the greatest!   I was here on a Sunday late afternoon. I already had lunch but my eyes were drawn to some woman at the bar plate looked yummy, wait smelled yummy; I did not have as a clear imagine as I wanted too since I was sitting at the window, but ease dropping on the food conversation and sounded like they LOVED IT!   The bartender there went out of his way to bring me some more water at the window! What The! SWEET! It was rather slow later afternoon nonetheless I have never experienced that kind of service from any bartender! 5 stars for that.
